heading.emphasis:
Pseudoanthidium ( Pseudoanthidium ) yanruae Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis : The new species is very similar to
P . ( P .) orientale
, but its frons is black, without oval yellow spot ( Fig. 8b ), clypeus yellow, with two black longitudinal belt-shaped markings ( Fig. 8b ), mandible of female with six teeth ( Fig. 8d ), mandible of male with three teeth ( Fig. 9b ), S8 of male sub-trapezoid-shaped, basal median with a spiculum (
Fig. 9g
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Pseudoanthidium ( Pseudoanthidium ) yanruae Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov. , female, holotype. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Head in lateral view; d: Mandible in lateral view; e: Mesosoma in dorsal view; f: Propodeum in dorsolateral view, showing the propodeal spiracle; g: Metasoma in dorsal view; h: Wing in frontal view. Scale bar: a, b, c, e, g, h, 1 mm; d, f, 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 9.
Pseudoanthidium ( Pseudoanthidium ) yanruae Niu & Zhu
, sp. nov. , male, paratype. a: Head in frontal view; b: Mandible in lateral view; c: T5-T7 in dorsal view; d: S4 in frontal view; e: S5-S6 in ventral view; f: S7 in ventral view; g: Genitalia and S8 in frontal view; h: Genitalia in dorsal view. Scale bar: a, b, c, d, e, f, 1 mm; g, h, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material :
Holotype : ♀ , China , Yunnan , Jingdong Xian ( 24º24′N , 100º48′E ),
2.V.1957
, leg. Zeng-Hao ZHU; paratypes : 1 ♀ , China , Yunnan , Dali, Diancang Shan ( 25º39′N , 100º06′E ),
14.IV.2009
, leg. Rui ZHANG ; 1 ♀ , China , Yunnan , Pu’er Xian, Ximahe Wetland Park ( 22º48′N , 100º58′E ),
24.IV.2018
, leg. Yong WANG ; 1 ♂ , China , Yunnan , Dali, Diancang Shan ( 25º39′N , 100º06′E ),
14.IV.2009
, leg. Rui ZHANG .
Etymology : The specific name is dedicated to Professor Yan-Ru Wu for her contributions to bee taxonomy.

Remarks: This species appears closely related to
P. orientale
as indicated in the diagnosis and may prove to be synonymous. The number of mandibular teeth is likely not diagnostic. A female of
P. orientale
from Thailand has six teeth on one mandible and five on the other. That Thailand specimen is more heavily maculated than
P. yanruae .
The male associated with this species does not differ from
P. orientale
in the combs of S5 and the shape of the gonostylus.
